She has like a 70% banrate diamond +

Her banrate in Diamond is the same reason for Yasuo's banrate in Bronze.

If the enemy team gets her it's going to be on a main that wipes your team single-handedly. If your team gets her they're going 0/10 and going to keep going in anyways.

Her average winrate even in Diamond+ is still only 47% or less. It goes up to *58%* on her mains, but average winrate (especially for first-time players) is just terrible.
Base win rates aren't really representative. High skill cap champs are usually like that. Akali is clearly overpowered when played at maximum potential tho.

Yea, I see her banned a lot. Honestly (note, I've only landed against her a few times, since I'm a supp main) I haven't found her impossible to deal with, I think that part of the ban rate is "she is op, imma ban her!" *doesn't learn how to play against her*, "oh, I didn't ban her...", *doesn't ban, gets demolished since they don't know the lane*, "she is op, imma ban her".

Her lane is pretty oppressive, but she is 100% not an auto win, especially with a sub 50% win rate.

She's powerful because she has another overloaded kit where if you're good enough, you can outplay nearly everything.

Healing, Sustained damage, Burst damage, Microstun + Dash, Execute damage, Dash, Bonus dash, Shroud that restores energy, Grants true stealth, Empowered auto attacks increasing both burst and sustained damage. I haven't even described her entire kit yet.

It's all got costs tho, so she can't do it all *at once*. You want to heal? Gotta save energy, so no wave clear or pressure. You want sustained? No healing, you're energy limited instead of cd limited so cdr doesn't save you much. Shroud being on energy restore means it's unlikely you use it optimally for both the safety and the energy regen, unless you're diving. In order to get the empowered auto you have to leave auto range, meaning you lose out on consistent damage for burst (creating mini trade windows) (side note, does rapid fire cannon give you the range to auto big champs from outside their circle? I've never seen her with one). Her wave clear prevents her from fighting any time soon, and wave clearing in a rush again prevents healing.

Honestly, I think her ult should have a small energy cost, but I don't think she needs the Nerfs this board demands, and her win rare reflects that imo.

Ya know Rabia played kayne earlier today. 
His words? 
"Kayne is hit or miss. He depends on whether or not your team reacts to the enemy jungler." 
And honestly... thats a pretty big if.

I agree, his main source of damage is from aoe skill-shots but they also offer him more range and thus protection than for example Yi who is always risking death by being aggressive. Higher elo's can predict linear gameplays so Yi doesn't work so well there. However, i have not seen a bigger abomination than a fed kayn.

Later in the game unlike other assassin, he feels as tanky as a real TANK and has usually lifesteal. He is maybe a bit weak early game (from my perspective) but scales way too much for an assassin.
